column4: What would be a good way to keep an auto.home directory mounted? Presently it it mounted when I log in and unmounts when I log out. This is messing with some cronjobs that are running out of my home directory. Moving them to a directory other than my home directory is not an option.

the mount command creates the error that says the directory is already mounted. Then the directory exists for an unknown amount of time before disappearing again. I'm hoping for a bit more reliability. Unless you know a good argument to pass to mount that I am not thinking of
maybe I'll just have the mount command run once an hour and pipe the error to /dev/null. hah
